channel.title: Posts on Vincenzo Galante
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Vincenzo Galante

item.title: Magic: The Gathering
item.description: I finished working on my first python cloud project and it marks a milestone for me. This project is about ‘Magic: The Gathering’ - a card game created in the early 90s, which I loved to play with my friends. We went from PokÃ©mon, to Yu-Gi-Oh! to Warhammer 40k. But Magic, really sticked with us. In this project I went from knowing nothing about a professional cloud and orchestration, to setting up a Google Cloud environment via terraform, orchestrating a data pipeline reading from an API to push data to Google Cloud Storage, to BigQuery, transforming my data with DBT and visualizing my insights in a Looker dashboard.

item.title: DataTalksClub - Data Engineering Zoomcamp
item.description: These last early mornings and late evenings have been filled with setting up my environment for the Data Engineering Zoomcamp. My current setup involves a virtual machine, hosting a Postgres database, while being able to query it through pgAdmin - pulling it all up via docker-compose. Furthermore, I got to know the basics on how to set up the Google Cloud infrastructure via Terraform. Within the next weeks, I will be working on workflow orchestration via Prefect, data warehousing in BigQuery, analytics engineering with DBT, and batch and stream processing with Kafka.

item.title: Where to start?
item.description: I wanted to learn more about data. How can data be stored? How do I get data from A to B? And how do I present data in a Dashboard? But where do you start when you have humanities complete knowledge at your fingertip? I felt overwhelmed, and still do. And it is totally okay. We all need time to adjust and sort things out. I started with the basics of the fundamental languages used for data jobs - SQL and Python.

item.title: First blog post ever
item.description: Hello out there, this is my first post. This is the start of a wonderful learning journey full of ups and downs, new insights and learnings. Originally, this blog should have been called “Vincenzo goes to Datahood”, but for the beginning I decided to keep it simple and start with GitHup pages only. Nevertheless, relax, take a seat and enjoy the ride. ðŸŽ¢

item.title: About me
item.description: ðŸ‘‹ Hello I am Vincenzo Galante and this blog is about my journey in Automation, Data and Analytics Engineering. From being a consultant for haute couture brands in Paris, to running strategic initiatives for the biggest European e-commerce platforms in Berlin - I already had some stations in my career. Over the last years I learned how to think like a product manager and gained hands-on full stack web development skills, just to find my true passion: Data.
